p: Baccharis L. (Asteraceae) is an important genus comprising 435 species distributed from Argentina to the United States (USA). In Brazil, the genus is represented by 179 species [ 1]. Several species of Baccharis are frequently used in traditional medicine as analgesic, antidiabetic, anti-inflammatory, digestive, diuretic, and spasmolytic agents [ 2, 3]. These properties provide an excellent rationale for systematically studying their therapeutic properties. However, the correct identification of different Baccharis species is challenging due to their morphological similarities. Moreover, many different species of Baccharis are collectively called “vassouras” in Brazil, causing further confusion [ 4].
